trans-unit.source: Provides validation of a <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> class is used to ensure that a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object meets specific criteria.
The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with two parameters ensures that both a minimum and a maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> value are adhered to.

The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with three parameters checks both the minimum and maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> values, as well as whether the validation range is exclusive.

The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with four parameters checks the previous three parameters and also checks whether the <xref:System.TimeSpan> value is equal to a specific number of seconds.
The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.CanValidate%2A> method determines whether the object type being validated matches the expected type.
The object being validated is passed as a parameter of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator"></xref> class, based on supplied parameters.

When the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with two parameters is used, the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> object validates that a <xref:System.TimeSpan> value adheres to a specific range.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the minimum time allowed to pass validation.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the maximum time allowed to pass validation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator"></xref> class, based on supplied parameters.
The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor checks both the minimum and maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> values, as well as whether the validation range is exclusive.
When the `rangeIsExclusive` parameter is set to `true`, the <xref:System.TimeSpan> value must not be between the `minValue` and `maxValue` values.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the minimum time allowed to pass validation.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the maximum time allowed to pass validation.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that specifies whether the validation range is exclusive.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator"></xref> class, based on supplied parameters.
When the `resolutionInSeconds` parameter is specified, the <xref:System.TimeSpan> object being validated must be equal to this value in order to pass validation.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the minimum time allowed to pass validation.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> object that specifies the maximum time allowed to pass validation.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that specifies whether the validation range is exclusive.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies a number of seconds.
resolutionInSeconds is less than `0`.
\- or -
minValue is greater than maxValue.
Determines whether the type of the object can be validated.
The type of the object.
`true` if the type parameter matches a value; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the value of an object is valid.
The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> object contains the rules necessary to validate a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object.
The rules are established when an instance of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> class is created.
The object to validate is passed as a parameter of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method.
The value of an object.
